text.section:
Subject to the limitations in this subtitle, an individual may qualify for a reciprocal license from a local jurisdiction of the State if the individual:
is licensed by another local jurisdiction of the State to provide electrical services in that local jurisdiction;
applies for a reciprocal license of the same class or type as the license that the individual holds in that local jurisdiction; and
at the time of application, does not have:
a license of the same class or type suspended or revoked by a local jurisdiction of the State; or
a record of outstanding violations of the regulations of a local jurisdiction of the State.

A local jurisdiction of the State that issues a license to provide electrical services shall waive any of the licensing qualifications of the local jurisdiction for an individual who:
is a resident of the State; or
meets the legal requirements of the State for establishing a principal place of business in the State;
holds a license, from another local jurisdiction of the State, of the same class or type as the license for which the applicant is seeking a waiver; and
meets the waiver requirements of subsection (c) of this section.

A local jurisdiction shall grant a waiver under this section for an applicant who holds a license from another local jurisdiction only if the applicant:
submits a written statement from the local jurisdiction certifying:
if a license is issued on the basis of an examination, the date of issuance of the license; and
the licensee:
pays any reciprocal license fee required by the local jurisdiction;
if required:
executes a bond to the local jurisdiction; or
submits proof of general liability insurance to the local jurisdiction; and
complies with any other licensing requirements of the local jurisdiction.
